website_summaries.verdict: If you are tired of dirty boosters that seem impossible to clean, this style wipes easily.
pros: It has a 3-point harness system to keep your child sturdy and safe
The insert can easily be taken out and cleaned
Kids can climb all over this and it will stay in place, sturdy, and strapped on your chair
cons: While this model is easy to clean,  you will have to watch the space between the insert and the base, because food can sometimes slide in between

customer_reviews.title: Modification Required
customer_reviews.text: This booster is a decent height that helps my smaller two year old sit at a good height for our standard dinner table. I was very disappointed when it arrived and the upper grey foam piece (for added height) had no way to attach to the bottom half hard piece with all the straps. I almost returned it. My daughter is VERY wiggly and it was sliding all over the place and I was not comfortable with it at all. I liked the quality and height so my husband and I decided to add heavy duty Velcro to attach the two pieces. It is far more secure and functional now.
customer_reviews.author: Amber B.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot attach to standard dining room chair.
customer_reviews.text: The seat is nice. Clean lines and good height. I am giving a 3 because you cannot attach them to a standard dining room chair without extensions. The straps provided are too short.
customer_reviews.author: NICOLE FALSONE

customer_reviews.title: Hated this booster seat
customer_reviews.text: This seat drove us crazy. The insert doesn't stay in well. Every time my son would climb in and out, the stupid thing would fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The are better choices out there
customer_reviews.text: Bought it and returned it. My two year old, who was very excited about sitting in this booster instead of her high chair, refused to get back in it after sitting in it only twice. There is almost no back support, so the child has to sit erectly. My daughter did not seem comfortable. Attaching the booster to the chair was not easy as well, as the shortest strap settings were too long for my chairs (solid oak chairs--nothing unusual). In addition, as others mentioned, the insert wobbles, which I think led to my daughter being uncomfortable as well. There are better choices out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: So I liked the sleek design of this booster. It fit on our chair beautifully. However, the crotch strap was fully extended and still didn't provide enough slack. My average sized two year old would put grow that by next month. Next, the manufacturer did not thread the back nylon strap correctly into the plastic adjuster. Therefore we couldn't pull it taut to be safe. Disappointed for sure
customer_reviews.author: MimiLadybug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my messy toddler
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old daughter loves sitting at the table with us and it's no longer a fight strapping her in to a high chair (pictures, and destined for the garage now). This booster saves space, fits my toddler, and is easy to clean and install! I'm looking forward to meals with my toddler now!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Poor straps and a shallow seat
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this chair over another brand for the straps to secure it to our high top table chairs. Every strap is not fed through the tension pulls to properly secure the straps. There is no way to correctly pull the straps tight. (See photos) Also the seat is VERY shallow, I should have confirmed the measurements prior to ordering, and we could have worked with the seat size.
customer_reviews.author: Clay & Kristen White

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: It comes apart every time you try to use it. I don't use it and it's setting in another room because I think it could be unsafe. The plastic seat is the part that comes off every time your child moves. Not happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: blsterling

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute, functional chair. Our table has a low hanging lip underneath and I was struggling to find a chair that was the right height. This is perfect, it's low enough to fit but high enough for the table to be functional to my toddler. My daughter is 16 months old...this chair works well for her now and I see it lasting until she no longer needs a booster. It looks nice and is easy to clean. I got the pink one (which looks very nice!) for $20 and I think that's a fair price. I would not pay the $35 that some of the other colors are listed at.
customer_reviews.author: ETop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: won't fit most dining chairs!
customer_reviews.text: the lower strap that fits under the seat to secure it is way too short for standard dining chairs. The straps are about 9 inches apart so obviously can't clasp. So, it's useless. Why don't they spend the 5 cents to make the strap longer?! Otherwise it looks like it would be fine. If you have a very small wooden chair like the one in the photo it probably works. But ANYthing upholstered or normal size is too big for this strap.
customer_reviews.author: kathhu

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: We have used this daily for nearly 6 months. My son is 2, but our table is a taller style. So this seat is necessary to keep him safe. It's been easy to keep clean, especially if I give it a quick wipe down after he eats. Even when I've missed a meal or missed a spot, it's cleaned up easily. It's holding up well! I wish the straps were a little more adjustable. I feel like he may out grow the seat before he's mature enough to sit safely in the chair without it. Also the colors are great, so it's not an eyesore, attached to my dining room chair.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cheek

customer_reviews.title: Practical booster seat
customer_reviews.text: Great booster seat for my toddler. We aren’t quite ready to allow our two year old freedom over how long he sits at the dinner table. The straps keep him securely and safely in his chair. The booster seat is the perfect height for him, it brings him up to the table so he can reach his plate to eat or to do activities like play-doh. The straps secure easily on our chairs and easily adjust- I think they would accommodate most chairs. The material easily wipes clean which is a must with our little one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! (Hard for upholstered chairs)
customer_reviews.text: It was finally time to transition to a booster from my sons high chair. This was the #1 recommended brand so I went with it! The chair itself looks really nice and it’s big enough for him to use it another year or so. The only small gripe I have, it’s VERY hard to assemble with upholstered chairs. It took my husband a couple tries and had to change some straps around but we finally got it to fit. We have upholstered captains chairs so if you have anything bigger I would not suggest buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H

customer_reviews.title: Don’t spend on big name brands buy this instead
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 19 month old when he started fussing every night when we put him in his highchair to eat dinner. He loves his booster seat he’s adjusting well to having just three straps. The surface of the seat is very wipeable and cleanable. The grips on the bottom of the seat are really grippy and effective against my wood chair. Overall it’s doing it’s job and I feel like we saved a lot of money over other much more expensive designer booster seats that look very similar.
customer_reviews.author: K. Long

customer_reviews.title: They had good intentions....
customer_reviews.text: If I still had the box for this then I would most likely return it. It does its job but actually is more of an inconvenience than anything. They make the blue seat removable so you can clean it but it actually wouldn't be that hard to just wipe it down without removing it. Unfortunately that's not possible because it is not tightly sealed in the seat and food/crumbs slip down into the under area so you have to take it off anyways but now you have 2 areas to clean. If I had to do it all over again, I would definitely go with a more simpler booster seat that didn't have any removable parts.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Annoying but functional.
customer_reviews.text: This does not stay still like past booster seats I've used. I have to readjust it on the wooden seat after nearly every use. The straps are way too long to attach it to a normal kitchen chair. Also, although it's nice that nothing is fabric, the grey piece slides on the base, leaving an irritating open home for crumbs to get under the seat. My 3 year old definitely likes it from a comfort standard. He prefers it to his other seat. I have not traveled with this, but I could only imagine how much of a pain that would be with the seat insert sliding everywhere and the seat straps getting tangled.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan J

customer_reviews.title: Overall great
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great booster. My daughter is thrilled to be out of her high chair! Comes apart and goes back together easily, meaning you can get in every nook and cranny without hassle. Only, minor, issue is that the straps prevent it from getting quite as tight around the back of the chair as I would look. Still very secure though, so not a major issue. Also, not ugly or brightly colored, which is always a perk for something you might leave out all the time.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: 1 Gripe
customer_reviews.text: This seat is great, and we don't have any trouble with the washable, removable insert sliding around as others have. My biggest complaint, however, is that the buckle is ridiculously hard to undo. I dread having to unbuckle it every time because it takes so much pressure to undo. With a toddler, we have had numerous buckle systems and I've never seen one this irritating. Hopefully the company can improve on this and make it a 5 star item!
customer_reviews.author: 41th3r3

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Fast delivery & item just as described. -Easy to clean -Easy to adjust the straps around the waist -Easily attaches to the back and bottom on the chair -Easy to wipe down and clean. CONS: -Low back.I didn't the low back factor into account when purchasing this item. My son used a high chair before and loved to lean back. Now with the switch to this item and the style of our chair he cannot lean back, but he is getting adjusted to this, and enjoys sitting at the dinner table like a grown up.
customer_reviews.author: tiffanylee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect booster seat
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic booster seat for toddlers and young children. The seat and straps are easy to clean, and the seat secures easily to every dining chair we've tried it on. The cushion is a coated foam which makes it comfortable while being easy to wipe food from. After the first one has worked, and still works, for our first child, we got another for our second child. There have been slight changes to the cushion molding but otherwise the product is the same great quality.
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built, but leg straps too tight and cannot be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on a positive review from my daughter, who has one. They look fine and install fine, but the leg straps on both on them are too tight for the little legs of my 20- and 19-month grandsons. There is enormous adjustment possible on the tie-down straps, but **next to none** on leg/seat straps. One of the boys is fairly slim, and they were tight on him too. I may well have to return both of these an find boosters with adjustable straps. I can't see how kids much younger than 20 months would be using booster seats so I cannot figure out why so tight.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Cool little seat
customer_reviews.text: The only problem we had was that our kiddo was too big for it after a couple of weeks, but that wasn't the seats fault. Our 3 years old is just big. Despite that, this seat is great...very easy to clean, appears comfy and it doesn't take up a whole bunch of space and I'm sure it would be great for traveling. I wish the security belt was built a little better, it seems a little on the cheaper side. Otherwise, if we had to buy another, or one as a gift, we probably would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE> BEST> BOOSTER>EVER
customer_reviews.text: We had a high chair for the baby, but we wanted to get back some kitchen space. This booster is great, it was so easy to clip around the chair. We put a small towel underneath it so it would not damage the chair. Our daughter loves being a big girl and she is so safe and secure in it. It was such a good price too! The cushion is removable, but I just like to flip it up to clean it. Honestly it is just a great booster. I prefer it to a high chair 100%. Our daughter just turned 1 by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, easy to travel with, comfortable, perfect
customer_reviews.text: This seat is perfect for our 20-month-old son who is too big for his high chair, but still too small to sit at the table on the chair on his own. It's SUPER easy to clean and transport. With family all over the state, we travel often. We can easily undo this seat and bring it with us and it fits on every chair we've ever tried. My son seems comfortable enough to sit here for a while watching TV, coloring, eating... It feels very durable, so we're hoping it survives for Baby #2.
customer_reviews.author: melly9889

customer_reviews.title: Y’all when it says SmartClean it means smart clean! We bought these to replaced horrible ones ...
customer_reviews.text: Y’all when it says SmartClean it means smart clean! We bought these to replaced horrible ones we had and they are amazing so far. The only possible down side thus far (in the week we have had them) is we bought the light green color and the insert seems to be stained already from Pasta sauce. We literallyclean it as soon as my kids are done eating so it wasn’t sitting for a long time. We haven’t tried bleach though so maybe that will help. Other than that no complaints and we LOVE them.
customer_reviews.author: Hehegirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect booster seat
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were desperate to find a way to keep our 16 month old at the table during meals. We also were so over cleaning the mess of a high chair, so we went for this. It's absolutely perfect and our toddler loves it. He knows where he is supposed to sit and sits for a long time now. I guess it makes him feel like a big boy. And since he's excited, it helped us restart our discipline for sitting at the table and enjoying being buckled. This booster seat is super easy to clean and install. You could easily transport it too. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Fairly unusable to say the least
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately not tall enough, and while I would normally modify any given item that doesn’t function well... this item is too far past in the design flaw department. If I were to put a phone book on this to make the child sit high enough on the table, then the straps wouldn’t be long enough. They are JUST along enough to barely clip on the longest setting around the chair alone, let alone if I were to post up the booster seat Design flaw!
customer_reviews.author: P. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great seat,
customer_reviews.text: Like the padded seat, appears to be comfortable for my son to sit in. Easy to attach to the chair and I like how I can push the chair all the way into/under the table instead of having leave it out like I had to with the space saver seats. Only dislike is how easily the removable gray padded seat comes away from the rest of the seat. I like that its removeable for cleaning, but i wish it would snap in place, or something to make it more secure. It moves out of place the entire time I’m taking him in/out which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: Not secure enough
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this seat is great. Super easy to clean! The thing I really don’t like about it is the seat that comes off to clean does not actually secure on. It’s really difficult for my toddler to get in and out on his own without it sliding around on him. He actually prefers to not use it. Kind of a waste for us. Would be a lot better if the seat that can be removed was more stable and secure when you put it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, fits in well with other decor, takes up hardly any space, easy to clean, and effective for boosting my toddler to table level. I love that we don't have to worry about having an extra piece of furniture in the dining room since this sits right on one of the existing chairs. The one design flaw is that the gray padded seat comes off pretty easily (which is great for cleaning) but I wish there was a way to attach it so that my toddler couldn't pull it off every day. It is a small inconvenience, but it is annoying to have to rethread the straps every time he starts tugging on the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mahaney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, but the top seat is a pain
customer_reviews.text: When we purchased the booster seat 'easy to clean' was my top priority, as we have a messy eater. This seat is definitely easy to clean, but the colored part of the seat does NOT stay on if you are trying to put a squirming toddler in it. I wish there was a way to 'clip' the blue seat in to the back, because it is very easily knocked off. We are using the seat without the blue part (for some reason the toddler likes it better that way) but it is still just an easy wipe down to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: This seat is okay. It’s extremely frustrating that the top part comes right off. My little one pulls it off almost every day. Even when he just gets off the seat, it pops up. There is nothing attached to the base of the seat, which is really weird. I will have to figure out how I can attach it so this doesn’t keep happening. I wish I had shopped around a bit before just spending my money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Franceski Jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this booster seat. I like the neutral color and how easy it is to install. It can easily be moved from one chair to another and the best part is how easy it is to clean! My daughter has a toddler table, but all of a sudden decided she wanted to sit at the grown-up table. This booster seat has helped our meal times tremendously. This is the only thing she allows us to buckle her into besides her car seat. She is also eating more now that she can’t get up and walk around! Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Payton & Kasi

customer_reviews.title: Stains quickly, doesn’t clean easily.
customer_reviews.text: Got this seat because reviews said it was easy to clean! While the seat does pop off nicely for a quick rinse, it Stained permanently after only a couple uses. I got the bright green color so perhaps a darker color wouldn’t be an issue but the foam-like seat seeps in stains from berries sweet potato tomato & the like! and no amount of cleaning bleach stain treatment removes them ... It’s a very basic product but I would recommend getting something nicer. The buckles are also difficult to do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but somewhat annoying at how easy the pad comes out
customer_reviews.text: Comes with straps to affix it to a chair, which should be compatible with any chair fit for a dining table (not bench seats). Also comes with straps to affix it to a toddler, which is sort of the point of this kind of chair. The gray seat pad is made of a dense, flexible foam and comes out so the whole thing can be cleaned. It's convenient, but somewhat annoying at how easy the pad comes out. There's very little to hold it in. Overall, the chair works well and does exactly what I need it to do. The boy hates it, but he'll get over it.
customer_reviews.author: The Ed

customer_reviews.title: No height adjustment, difficult to prop up and to tighten straps
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. Love the adjustable crotch strap (a rare feature). Issues: The straps have sliding tighteners that make it hard to synch down the seat. It’s hard to get them very tight, and the straps are such that the tighteners slide easily (so they don’t stay tight for long). No height adjustment mechanism. It sits too low for our table. Tried putting it atop a booster cushion, but the seat is open on the bottom and quite broad, so it is not easy to prop up (on a phone book etc).
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Berger

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: This was a good seat to transition to for our 2 year old from a high chair. I'm not sure if our chairs are low down but the booster seat still feels a little low, also I don't know how we will use it without the straps as it moves around constantly when not strapped in, for now it's doing the job though and we use it for most meals. Easy to clean and clasp.
customer_reviews.author: ivyleague4

customer_reviews.title: Great booster, easy to clean, very comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, love the removable cushion. If you have a chair with a curved back this may have to be set "just so" in order for it to be securely attached. We have these type of chairs and it take an extra minute or so to be sure everything is balanced so both rear corners are pushed up against the back of the chair securely. It doesn't offer any additional back support from the chair back itself in this case but our little one doesn't seem to mind.
customer_reviews.author: Bhintx

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: He loves sitting in his big boy chair. Unfortunately, he is able to buckle and unbuckled himself. This maybe his new favorite toy. I like the two part design to take it and wash the seat without removing the entire seat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Low profile, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this booster to replace a Fisher-Price Healthy Care Deluxe Booster that I loooved and purchased in 2011. I still have the fisher price but it now stays in the car for use when we go out. But I needed something in the house for my 3 yo. This was it. Fastens tightly to my regular dining chairs, easy to clean, low profile so the chair can be pushed in and my child sits at the table with the rest of us 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: Works for our 18 mo old and our 3 yr old
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these a couple years ago for our first born. We liked it enough to by one when I came time for our second born to sit at the table with us. I do like that the sides are higher on the sides, however when trying to clean you can’t remove the center belt on the grey portion and run under the sink without getting that portion wet. That’s the only downfall for us. But this wouldn’t stop me from buying this again
customer_reviews.author: Megan Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, but not for all toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loved this seat but as my grandson grew he could not resist pulling back the foam insert, it's a heavy molded flexible plastic. The last time he visited he pulled it back towards himself, while sitting in the chair, when he let go of the molded insert it snapped and somehow pinched his finger... enough that he cried and it left a red mark. It's a great seat if you have a child that isn't a Curious George! Sadly we had to get rid of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but disfunctional
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but the unattached seat is a big problem. The “convenience” of it easily coming off to clean doesn’t outweigh the major inconvenience of it not attaching in some way to the base. My kids hold on to the back of the seat to climb up into it, and with that loose seat, they could no longer climb up on their own with nothing in place to hold on to. Rather than bother returning it, I drilled holes to attach it to the base with screws.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Smoke

customer_reviews.title: So easy to clean and use!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this booster seat for how easy it is to clean and keep clean. My 2-year-old will try to run around the house with his food. So this thing is perfect for him right now. We did have to take out the grey part though. It made him look like he was floating and I was afraid he would fall off the side. The white part is easy to wipe off and hasn't stained at all (not even when my lil one eats blueberries making himself look like he just murdered a smurf)! All I have to do is just wipe it down with a wet wash rag after wiping him down. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price and convenience
customer_reviews.text: These are good for the price and convenience. These are perfect at home and for traveling - they sit up high enough that the children feel they are "adults" and love being at the big table with everyone else. Comes apart easily for clean up. Would recommend to anyone looking for a booster seat to take with them or leave at home.
customer_reviews.author: Kendy A. Troiano

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a bulky high chair with tray. It works perfectly, and chair now fits under rhe kitchen table. I read that previous reviews said that the kids slide on the grey top, not my case. My 3 year old sits on it, eats and is done, the grey cushion doesn't slip and slide for us. It is not attached, so you can lift up and wip it down, but doesnt slip while the kid is on it
customer_reviews.author: ZOEYLOVESTOSHOP

customer_reviews.title: grey and white
customer_reviews.text: wish i bought this sooner.. 100% worth it and WAY better than cleaning a big highchair. All i have to do is wipe down the table which i do anyways. the plastic on the booster wipes clean so easily and you could also wash it in the sink if it got very messy. this would make a great baby shower gift and its affordable.
customer_reviews.author: julia Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This seat did the job in that it helped my 3 year old sit at a better height at the kitchen table, but cleaning this chair is the worst. The top gray piece is removable and it always gets food underneath it, so not only do you need to wipe clean the gray part but the actual white seat underneath. Having to wash 2 different surfaces is not a time saver for a busy parent. I did not care for this design. It also moves around and the seat belt I’m constantly having to feed back through the holes. It’s kind of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: BECMK0629

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for young toddlers who will no longer use a regular high chair
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her booster seat. She started refusing to let us put the tray on her high chair and this was the perfect solution. I like that the grey piece is removable to wipe clean but she will take any and everything apart and would always take it off so we just use the white part as her seat without the grey piece. The buckles are much more complex than her high chair so little risk of her figuring out how to undo it (she can still buckle it herself though at 1 1/2).
customer_reviews.author: Girl Mom 2

customer_reviews.title: Sanity Saver
customer_reviews.text: Great booster, started my son at 15 months. Attached perfectly to my chairs, with no wiggling. He's strong and a climber, and can't get put of the harness, so it's safe. And he's the perfect height at our dinner table. SO MUCH EASIER than a highchair. I'll never own a full size highchair again. #Boostersforlife Easy to clean, seat pops right out. This purchase has helped save my meal-time Mom sanity, and my baby loves being a "big boy" and eating more inclusively with us!
customer_reviews.author: MrsArmendarez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter when she was around 18 months old because I was tired if trying to clean the fabric on her high chair that could not be removed from the chair. I wish I had bought this from the very beginning! It's so much easier to clean off and wipe down. The straps are easy to remove and are machine washable. This is a life saver when potty training accidents regularly happen during dinner. At this point my daughter is 2 and she can climb into the seat and buckle herself which has helped her to feel more independent and saved me time at meals.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Pischke

customer_reviews.title: This was just perfect as its not too high
customer_reviews.text: Our table has a lip/apron so i was limited to the amount of leg room. This was just perfect as its not too high. Though the grey cushion part I wish fit in a little bit for snug- it just sits losely in the seat. And the latch could be designed with a button to release both sides at once. But since I was needing a boaster that worked with our table, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: ASacCa

customer_reviews.title: Safe and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot and it’s super comfy for my 17 month old. Very easy to clean and wipe down. And I’m my last pic you can tell I have the chair on its side and the safety strap keeps it from moving so it great that you can rely on it to be very tight and fastened to seat. I just wish they had cute colors and designs haha. It’s portable but big and bulky
customer_reviews.author: Jaylen Montano

customer_reviews.title: Great seat easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Best booster seat. Will buy more. Tried a few other brands and don’t like them. The buckles get nice and snug and secure compared to other brands. However, the waist buckle snapped one day and broke while I was buckling my kid in. I did nothing different but it just snapped so now only one side buckles but I will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Transitioning my toddler from a high chair to regular chair using this product. The straps securing the booster seat to the chair make are very sturdy and really lock the booster seat in place - no wobbling! The straps securing my child to the seat are also sturdy and prevent her from climbing off or wiggling out. Cleaning this seat is super easy as everything can be wiped down. In retrospect, I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Skipton

customer_reviews.title: It's actually very annoying to keep putting it back in place
customer_reviews.text: As the others have complained about, the cushion/foam support does NOT stay on and there's no way to attach it without gluing it down. It's actually very annoying to keep putting it back in place. When my son jumps out of the chair, he has to put it back every time. Quality of the actual booster part is good. It works for a booster seat, but would definitely go with another brand/type next time.
customer_reviews.author: Abbadeer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works but several issues. Straps don't stay in place. If the kid moves around, they loosen up. Buckle is a bit tricky and not friendly. Also, my kid likes to lean back and due to how it is designed, she arches her back. You can sit straight in this seat but if you lean back up against the chair back, it is a quite an arch for her.
customer_reviews.author: Pooch

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Fits well on the dinner table’s chair. Fastens nicely. First time my toddler used it, he did well on it. I do advise that if your little one moves around a lot that they have constant supervision, as they may be able to wriggle around more. But over all. I do like this high chair and I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel highchair
customer_reviews.text: I wish we would have purchased this a long time ago. So convenient for travel and restaurants with crappy highchairs. Definitely recommend for parents of babies and toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Great for having our toddler feel like every else at the table!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my 2 year old. We got rid of the bulky high chair and now our toddler can join us at the table. She loves feeling like a big kid. It is very safe, easy to clean, easy to move, and easy to take with when traveling. We might buy another one to take to restaurants or keep at Grandma's house.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Lobert

customer_reviews.title: Not the best fit
customer_reviews.text: Though these seats are easy to clean, and easy to install on a chair, it has to be a fairly large chair to lock tightly and safely. I needed it for my daycare. The seats are smaller and the belts that lock the seat into place had to be modified to hold the seat securely without the kids falling over in the chair if they wiggled around. So, it you have a large chair, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Blair

customer_reviews.title: Pad doesn't stay put
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at all the high ratings... I'm using this for my 3 year old and its our first booster seat, and we've been using it a day and I already want to return. We need to use the pad because of the height of our table, but annoyed to say that the pad just doesn't stay put, especially with a little one squirming around. There really should be a way to affix the pad to the seat (velcro, for example). Might just end up buying some velcro and doing it myself, but really shouldn't have to. Looks good and easy to clean so has that going for it I suppose!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Best seat for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for your toddler. The securing straps fit nicely around the chair and are easy to pull tight. The seat insert provides that extra lift and is easy to clean. The insert is a squishy, plastic, foam. It is not a hard plastic. What I really like is the straps that secure your child in. They are easy to clip together and keep child in. This seat is easy to clean. It also has rubber feet to make sure it doesn't slide around on the chair also.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Wahl

customer_reviews.title: Good height, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been really happy with this chair. It fits on our dining chair, secures well, and my 2-yr-old and climb in and out of the seat by herself. It’s the perfect amount of boost for her, and it wipes off really easily with a baby wipe. The only small annoyance is that the gray piece/insert isn’t actually secured in any way, so my toddler can easily lift it off the rest of the booster and then carry it around the house. I’m sure it’s designed that way to make it easy to clean. Minor annoyance, not a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Erin A.

customer_reviews.title: Not too safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought the version before this for my oldest and she loves it. This was for my 2nd daughter and she practically falls out of it. The blue rubber is detachable for cleaning purposes, but there is nothing stopping it from sliding off the chair. The older version had a bit of a lip on the crotch area that allowed the rubber to stay in place. This one does not.
customer_reviews.author: Paris K.

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and the perfect height
customer_reviews.text: I love the Ingenuity seats! I have one for my 3-1/2 year old daughter and a different version for my 1-1/2 year old son. I took the buckles off this one as I don’t have issues with my 3 year old climbing out of her seat and onto the table. Without the buckles attached it’s so much easier to clean, I hated “lacing” the buckles our when they were covered in banana... My favorite part is the low profile quality or it and that it ticks under my table.
customer_reviews.author: WashedUpWild

customer_reviews.title: Perfect seat
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now had this product for a few months and my 2 1/2 y/o daughter uses it a few times every day and loves it. She was getting frustrated with the full seats I think because she thought they were for babies, but not this one. She eats well and will even sit in it for a long time if it’s a longer meal. The only thing I would suggest is using a sturdy chair underneath or make sure the child is not rocking or leaning too hard to any side, as we have had a couple close calls but that was also because she was really clowning too much in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy brother and two sisters

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.  Comes apart.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the idea of removable top for cleaning. But we have found the top is just too loose. Can be difficult to get child seated because the top keeps coming off and must be reset. Can even come loose during use if child is very wiggly. We will be replacing with better seat. This is something that is supposed to make life easier, so it's just not worth dealing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Goos

customer_reviews.title: My kid was fine but it could have been a bad situation
customer_reviews.text: After 1 month of use one of the straps came apart without warning. My kid was fine but it could have been a bad situation. Upon inspection it is held together by a piece of plastic thinner than a credit card. Emailed the company ingenuity with no response. Called and spoke with a woman who said there was nothing she could do until I sent this one back to her. I would try to find a different brand/model if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Jason King

customer_reviews.title: Perfect booster for my toddler!
customer_reviews.text: This booster seat was perfect for my toddler! We transitioned him from the high chair to a booster seat so I could use the high chair for my younger daughter. I love that you can attach it to the chair and it definitely feels secure. I also love that there's a buckle which helps prevent the little one from falling, or escaping (let's be honest). It's a perfect height for him to eat at the table too. I also love that you can take off part of the seat to easily clean it. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good, but costs too much...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: sleek & aesthetic design fits underneath table while on chair, so hides well buckle straps, that are machine washable easy to clean curved back hugs baby Cons: The foam pad that is engineered to pull out for easy cleaning, unfortunately comes off WAY too easy and thus falls on the floor repeatedly. Understandably if they made a lip then food would catch, so it's kind of a toss up... I rated three stars because I think $30 is a bit pricey for this considering it's not too much of a step up from the Babies R Us simple booster that is mega cheaper; we bought with LO # 1.
customer_reviews.author: Rooted Love

customer_reviews.title: Great booster seat for my 1 year old who wants ...
customer_reviews.text: Great booster seat for my 1 year old who wants to be at the big table with everyone else. Perfect height for my son to be able to reach the table top. This has 2 security straps for the table chair but unfortunately one of the straps is not longer enough for my chairs. Only thing I wish was different would be that those straps were a bit linger for larger chairs.
customer_reviews.author: DebbyH

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after a year
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2.5yo who needed an extra boost at the dinner table, and can't quite handle the "freedom" of the big chairs yet. It's been a great in-between chair. It's been a year now, and we still use it daily. She can hop up in it and buckle herself in which is great. We take it with us when we go to friends/families houses. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Mikkiah

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler seats
customer_reviews.text: We have twins and bought two of these. It's nice to be able to put the high chairs away and save some space. These seats are easy to take apart when needed so easy to clean - just wipe and go! The lap straps work great too. We are very happy with these seats. Just don't put the actual seat insert in the dishwasher. Ours shrank a little - our fault!
customer_reviews.author: Chris &.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for parents!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have a 2 year old and a 4-1/2 year old. They BOTH love this chair. It’s comfotable for them, doesn’t restrain them too much, and boosts them the perfect amount. Our 2 year old can climb fairly easily up and into the chair which makes it great for Mom and Dad when we are cooking and almost done. This thing is built nicely and will last for years
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: My 18 month old loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Today is the first time we used this chair and we used it for breakfast. My son is 18 months old. We just took him out of a Chicco pocket chair because his legs weren’t able to go under the table any longer. This booster is perfect and well hidden under the table. Like many noted in here, the straps are a little loose going around the back of the chair but we just wrapped them around one more time and they fit perfect. So far my son loves the chair, irs easy to clean, duarable and goes right under the table. We love it! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R

customer_reviews.title: Works well just not convenient
customer_reviews.text: This product isn’t bad or defective there are just better versions of booster chairs out there. The seat cover detached and the buckets get caught between the cover and the plastic. It fits on all the chairs we have however the back pegs fall off where it’s not on the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: If you have a toddler, you know what a mess they make. I looked for a booster seat that was easy to clean, and this is it. Not many crevices to clean, and the straps make it perfect for a chair and very sturdy. We use this for my two year old to sit at the table with us to eat, and she cant get out of the buckles herself. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sterlin Arledge

customer_reviews.title: I want to like it but it has some issues
customer_reviews.text: I love the soft seat and colors. The buckles and straps are frustrating because the webbing is too thin for the buckles and it slips. I couldn't get the straps to stay tight. I cut at the stitching, doubled the strap and then re- threaded it. It holds tight now. The seat is quite wide and doesn't fit on our chairs well. Also, the rubber part doesn't stay in place very well. It slips around and makes me nervous. I like the ideas of this seat, but it needs some improvement in the product development department.
customer_reviews.author: Tamclayton

customer_reviews.title: Separates with each descent from the throne
customer_reviews.text: The gray part removes from the white part with an odd ease. Every time our kid tried to get out the gray part went along with her bum. We returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great Booster Seat
customer_reviews.text: We travel a lot to see family and everyone has different styles of chairs/tables - so this was versatile. The adjustable straps make it easy to move, and it's fairly compact so it doesn't take up a ton of room in the car (when we travel). It's very easy to clean. The only thing I don't love is that the colored foam seat is a separate piece from the base, so my son will run over and take the top piece off and I have to reassemble it. And when traveling I have to tighten the lap belt so the top piece can't come off.
customer_reviews.author: Hali Bell

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver with small kids
customer_reviews.text: I love these seats and I love that they are so easy to clean. I got one for both of my kids, 3 & 1 because the high chair was such a hassle. With this seat, the bottom cushion comes out and wipes down the easily, and then the plastic under can be washed out and also the straps remove and are machine washable. It takes the hassle out of taking everything apart and cleaning it each time. There's also a little handle in back which is handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey H

customer_reviews.title: Toddler likes it.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is enjoying being able to get in and out of his big boy seat, he will even buckle him self in. I guess 4 inches is about standard for a booster seat, I would love one to be a bit higher but I can't find one anywhere. He's avarage sized and This seats him at the table about chest hight.
customer_reviews.author: Thompsolonian

customer_reviews.title: Good seat.
customer_reviews.text: I like this seat. It stays in place on the chair its sturdy and easy to clean up. It sits at the table at a good height for my 14 month old with plenty of room to grow into. The only thing I don't like is that the pad isn't secured in any way. It just sits on top of the plastic part of the seat. So it could slide if your child gets in and out of the chair on their own. Still a good seat.
customer_reviews.author: Momma octopus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddler!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 1/2 yr old grandson outgrew the highchair, but was too small to sit on our dining chairs without a boost. This is perfect! It's sturdy, has straps to make it secure, and easy to buckle him into. I took it with me when we all vacationed together -- didn't take up much room at all in the car. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Used on a wide dining chair
customer_reviews.text: The straps don’t fit as intended on a super wide dining chair, so we had to improvise. (My chair seats are 22” wide and 4.5” thick.). Other than that, it works great. Something to note: food crumbs DO get through the middle belt hole, as unlikely as that may seem, so make sure to clean under the ENTIRE thing, not just the foam insert part. I didn’t catch this until a few days in, but now clean under the whole thing every time.
customer_reviews.author: Kona

customer_reviews.title: Worked so well bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we’ve purchased as we were so happy with our first one. Now both my kids sit in them. Very easy to secure to chair & fit my fairly smaller children very well. Easy to take apart for cleaning & give them enough height at the dinner table.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Row

customer_reviews.title: Less is more!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Exactly what I was looking for! No fussy pieces to deal with simple yet efficient! Living in a small space we needed something that would hide away easily! And something easy to clean! Nothing complicated just a secure seat so our son can sit at the table! The gray part of the seat comes right off, the straps are very secure but can slide out with no problem (for an adult) to throw them in the wash if need be! My son has no fuss when it's time to eat he loves sitting in his big boy chair!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for littles!
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat for our 3.5 year old-he has been sitting in one since he was almost three. Yes, the top comes out, but with our son we haven’t had problems with him sliding around or anything. He’s not very rambunctious at the table, though. It’s durable, comfortable (says my three year old...) and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Clapper

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was needing for my 2 year old! It feels very sturdy and my daughter has no problem climbing in and out of it on her own. It arrived covered in a thin black dust, which was strange. But luckily I was able to wipe it down and remove all the dust. I wish the green, removeable cushion was more stationary and didn’t move so easily. But overall I’m very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my 2-y-o granddaughter to use on her last visit since she now feels she is too old for a high chair. This seat was great. It was an appropriate height, pushed close to the table, and strapped her in safely. In fact, she and her parents liked it so much that they took it with them when they went home. I will be purchasing another before her next visit. I got it in green, which was exactly true to the color on my computer screen and was a bright, pleasant, modern, and not-too-girly-color.
customer_reviews.author: AvlSan

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite booster
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this seat, we ended up returning it. I thought it'd be a nice sleek modern looking booster seat for my toddler to get in and out of. It did look nice but wasn't functional for us. There seemed to be spots where food could get stuck around the buckle and didn't seem very easy to clean. With multiple kids in seats I need something that's going to be a quick clean up without a lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping toddler off the table
customer_reviews.text: This seat is very easy to install and clean off. It's also perfect for keeping your toddler from climbing on the table during dinner and stepping in the mashed potatoes. As long as you actually, ya know, USE the included seat belt. Otherwise, it's right back into the mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps his little tushie at the table
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job keeping my almost three year old in his seat at the table. Now if only it could make him eat his vegetables and stop sneaking the dogs snacks. Easy to install and remove if needed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Combs

customer_reviews.title: A good seat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, nice simple design and works well. My only complaint is that the gray part easily comes out so when my daughter (3.5) is trying to climb up herself, sometimes it moves on her and she has to get down and fix it before trying again.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney2803

customer_reviews.title: I never write reviews
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but this little booster has come in so handy that I need to tell people!! We just moved (well still in the process) and don’t have access to our highchair for two months. We’ve used this booster in hotels, on the road, at family members houses! Super convenient, super light, easy to clean and affordable. We are very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Spector

customer_reviews.title: Seems okay
customer_reviews.text: It seems like an okay chair. I just took the cover off as I can imagine it being an annoyance from falling off. The straps that go under the chair weren't long enough, but the other straps might do the trick of keeping it in it's place. Hoping it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Transitional Seat
customer_reviews.text: This booster is genius. 1st,it straps to the chair for safety unlike other boosters. I don't know about you but my daughter doesn't understand the concept of not leaning. So this perfect. 2nd,its the perfect height. Other boosters were either too tall and we couldn't scoot her forward. Others were too short. This one has 2 stages. After your child gets taller, you can remove the green portion. Finally everything is easily cleaned. All the straps come off for washing.
customer_reviews.author: AmAT

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that would be easy to clean, secure, and then easy to store/travel with. This fit the bill for everything. My toddler does like to pull the soft cushion part out and run around with it, but I've found that buckling the seat after he gets out keeps this from happening!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This booster is great! It is the perfect height to fit under our table when not in use. Only possible concern is if the straps would be long enough to reach around a chair if it were bigger than ours. The belts are fully expanded and fit PERFECT, but if the chair was an inch bigger or wider they would not fit.
customer_reviews.author: James

product_meta.title: Ingenuity SmartClean Toddler Booster Seat - Slate (Item may slightly vary)
product_meta.description: Color:SlateThe SmartClean Toddler Booster stands up to the toughest mealtime messes. When your baby graduates from a high chair, this wipeable design is exactly what every toddler parent needs. Just wipe down the soft insert so you can spend less time cleaning and more time cuddling, playing or chasing after mealtime. The feeding seat easily straps onto most dining chairs and offers just the right height for your little big kid. Even the squirmiest toddlers will sit comfortably on the roomy and soft foam insert, and our 3 point harness keeps your child secure. It’s easy to clean, easy to use, and easy to take on the go. To avoid strangulation, never place near a window with cords for blinds or drapes. Foam can be dishwasher safeWipe clean.
feature_bullets: Removable foam insert easily removes for cleaning
Lightweight design is easy to take on the go
Neutral and modern slate color fits any home
Age Range: 16 months - 3 years; Max.Weight: 50 pound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,222 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
